data: DNA-TRAP – Delivery of Nucleic Acid-Based Therapeutics for the TReatment of Antibiotic-Resistant Pathogens

Antimicrobial agents, such as antibiotics, have dramatically reduced the number of deaths from infectious diseases over the last 70 years. However, through overuse and misuse of these agents, many micro-organisms have developed antimicrobial resistance. Oligonucleotide therapeutics have the potential to become the new class of antibacterials capable of treating a broad range of infections. By acting on novel targets, they circumvent current resistance mechanisms and with judicious use, can suppress the rise of future resistance.

DNA-TRAP will build on a platform technology that uses proprietary nucleic acid-based Transcription Factor Decoys (TFDs) that act on novel genomic targets by capturing key regulatory proteins to block essential bacterial genes and defeat infection. Taking forward newly emerging insights and expertise that exists within each of the partners and through the mutual secondment of researchers, the project aims to develop a new class of nanoparticulate antibacterials capable of meeting the clinical challenge of drug-resistant infections such as Clostridium difficile and Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

DNA-TRAP will establish a lasting, international partnership for transfer of knowledge between Industry and Academia in the field of nanomedicine. Exchange of knowledge and expertise between the partners is key to establishing the fundamental properties of nanostructured drug delivery systems to treat bacterial infections and through this, provide the basis for building a manufacturing platform to advance the experimental therapeutic into clinical trials.

17 researchers in the field of drug development and delivery from 2 commercial (SME) and 2 non-commercial partners across 2 member states, will have the opportunity to share and acquire new complementary and multidisciplinary knowledge, through inter-sectoral and interdisciplinary exchange, allowing for the development of new solutions and the establishment of further joint research projects.
Nanotherapeutics for antibiotic resistant emerging bacterial pathogens
Diocese of Norwich Education and Academies Trust - The Open Academy

The Secondary School IES El Carrascal is the only bilingual school situated in Arganda del Rey, Madrid. One of the main features of this school is that it has a special classroom for students with Autism Spectrum Disorder, unique in the area of Arganda del Rey too. Apart from this feature, there are also different projects which are being carried out in our shcool, which are as follows:

AVE FÉNIX: This project aims at preventing early dropout and works with students who are at risk of leaving school.
REDES: This project tries to improve students´results by helping students in their organization skills and their study habits.
MEDIACIÓN Y CONVIVENCIA: This project has been carried out for the last 5 years and its main aim is to make students help each other and solve different problems that may arise within the school environment.
MENTORING AND ACCOMPANYING: This is the second year we take part in this project where we observe the way another Secondary School is organized and teachers get to observe other teachers in their classrooms.
This year, we are going to start a new project where people from outside the school environment (parents, relatives, friends...)can participate in school and in the classrooms and hopefully it will be successful.
Therefore, with this project we aim at improving our own school projects by acquiring new knowledge that could be implemented and added to the ones already carried out. Therefore, 11 teachers and 1 Social Integrator will take part in the activities. Some of these teach at the bilingual programme, others participate in one or more of the projects that take place in the school and all of them work with the ASD students. With this project we hope then to improve in the following areas:
-Improvement of the linguistic competences and CLIL methodologies and tools to implement in class.
-Improvement of methodologies and acquisition of tools and ideas to implement in class with ASD students to improve their integration.
-Improvement of the different projects carried out in school dealing with prevention of early dropout, improvement of results and improvement of the education using people from outside the school environment. 
As we are going to be able to observe another school in England and learn about the different methodologies they carry out, our main aim will be to find out a common interest and objective to be able to carry out an Erasmus Plus KA2 for our students´mobility in the near future.
Finally, a seminar and workshop will be carried out so the rest of teachers can benefit as well from this knowledge.
Thanks to this project,  our school will be present in Europe and hopefully we can increase our contacts network which will lead to the development of future collaboration with similar schools to ours.
Diocese of Norwich Education and Academies Trust - The Open Academy

IES El Carrascal is a Secondary School situated in the Southeast of Madrid, in Arganda del Rey, and counts on 671 students aged between 11 and 18 years old. It has a special classroom for students with Autism Spectrum Disorder and there are also 26 students with Special Education Needs. 
Several projects are being carried out in our school: 
MEDIATION AND COEXISTENCE: 
The main objective of this project is to improve coexistence through the help among equals selecting students who have pro social characteristics, training them to solve in a peaceful way the conflicts that may arise in the school. The mediation team is formed by 11 teachers in total plus the Social Integrator, the two PTs and two “helping students” from every group. 
AVE FÉNIX:  
The objective of this project is to detect and prevent early school dropout in students in the 3rd and 4th year of ESO who are at risk of not getting a certificate and to help them pass so they do not drop out of school. There are 6 teachers and 35 students involved in this project. 
TEA CLASSROOM AND SPECIAL NEEDS STUDENTS: 
There are 5 students with ASD, whose main classroom is “Aula Carrascal” where they spend a lot of time with the Social Integrator and the PTS (Pedagogical Therapist Teachers) . Besides, there are 26 Special Needs Students integrated in our school.  
CREANDO REDES: 
This project helps 35 students in their first year of Secondary Education to organize their school diary and material to improve their results. 4 teachers are involved in this project.
INTERACTIVE WORKSHOPS: 
In this project, people from outside the school or with an indirect relation with it, intervene and participate in the classrooms together with the teachers, with the aim of improving their results. A total of 10 teachers and 150 students participate in this project. 
PROJECT E-TWINNING: 
In this project, students from schools in Spain and France collaborate in an interactive way to carry out the project “the night of the story”. It is formed by 16 students aged 16/17 years old from our school and one teacher with the collaboration of the teacher in charge of the library. 
In general terms, the teachers are interested in improving their teaching skills in order to improve the atmosphere in the classroom as well as in being able to manage their personal and professional lives in a satisfactory way. 
The participants will be selected according to the established scale giving preference to the teachers involved in the projects already mentioned and relevant for the mobilities.  In total, there will be 11 participants out of which one will do a Job Shadowing and the other 10 will attend different training courses. 
Our main objective is the improvement in the development of the projects afore-mentioned taking into account the necessities detected in each one, besides improving the centre internationalization. 
The activities we are intending to carry out are as follows: 
*A Job Shadowing in the Secondary School “Open Academy” in Norwich, England, where the teacher will focus on the methodologies used with ADS  and SEN students with the aim of improving our tools and techniques used with these students and integrating them better into our school.  
* Training courses for teachers found in the School Education Gateway platform to improve the projects of mediation to improve co-existence, detect and solve problems in school. Furthermore, a course to detect and prevent early dropouts from  school. A course to acquire new ideas to apply non -formal methodologies in the classroom and also regarding coaching to improve the professional and personal life of our teachers. 
Thanks to the publicity that the project will gain through the discussion forum, the documents elaborated for the use of the teachers, and the use of the digital platforms such as the school and Town Hall websites, Twitter, Facebook, the school magazine, Arganda´s magazine and the contacts we hope to create with other schools, there will be an internationalization of the school which will have effects inside and outside our school. Therefore, we hope we will be able to carry out other European projects such as Erasmus + KA1 or e-twinning projects in the near future.
